intro: Haloragis acanthocarpa, commonly known as the spiked thornweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal and sandy environments. The plant features small, green, ovate leaves arranged in opposite pairs along its stems. Its flowers are clustered in dense, cylindrical spikes and are usually white or pale green in color. Haloragis acanthocarpa is adapted to saline and arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
